66Fyw88IlLvF7OlQh3JynA.text: The only thing more impressive than the incredible food is the amazing customer service. I'm hard to impress. These guys impress me every time.

BXMJhpEEz1heyn9CPyRJ8A.text: I guess now they're ready for prime time.  I've eaten at this location a few times since they first opened up and results have been uneven but I think they've worked out the kinks.   I tried the falafel twice and it was the tastiest I've had in this city, by far. The shwarma with hummus ($8.50) is excellent, I ordered it with a combination of both chicken and beef-lamb shwarma on it, both meats were tasty and moist the humus was primo and there was more food that I could eat.    Henny the waiter was professional and personable both, a nice change of pace  from the typically friendly but clueless service we see so much of today.  btw they open every day of the week

photos.caption: Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States

ZFe3PS4r9Jj3V_qp8xnN-w.text: I told my husband I wanted to go out and eat healthy. I wasn't sure where he was going to take me. We ended up here and I was amazed!! So many healthy and delicious option. The service was always top notch!  I am extremely excited for their second  location to open at Stone Crest across from the movie theater.

nN2uqRW8kJr_KHCl2gagxw.text: I was recently visiting family in NC and my daughter insisted we have lunch here. So glad we did! The food is authentic and amazing! I had the minced lamb kebab! Delicious! You have to be open to the real deal here! Lebanese at its finest! No fake American altered cuisine! You get to watch them prepare your food fresh too! The food case was so beautiful in the center of it all that I had a hard time deciding what to order! Lol!   I over heard someone not happy with their dish and the server was extremely accommodating to replace it for them right away! I could tell it was the flavor and not the dish!!!!! Remember, you have to have the palette for authentic cuisine! This is no run of the mill place!    The owner went out of his way to greet us. Since my daughter frequents the place, they were very attentive, but I noticed that all the guest are treated that way too! I loved the flavors of my food so much that I had to score a container of spice to bring back to Arizona! They have a small selection of items you can purchase and the staff will educate you on how to use them. I've used this particular spice, not sure the name of it, the tag came off during my travels, on everything from my morning eggs to my chicken, fish and of course LAMB! Wow!   Lastly, it is a great place for inside or outside seating, large or small groups except call ahead for parties over 10 so they can accommodate you accordingly. Great place for the family! The granddaughter was happy at the young age of 2 1/2 yrs old!  Seems to be ideal for catering, but not sure if they offer that. Just ask!  This will be my first stop when I return to NC in the future! Can you open one in Scottsdale??? I haven't found a good Lebanese place here yet!   Enjoy!  Pamela

Oo9mHP6qVJbQDiJrLfUzjA.text: My family and I have tried many of the appetizers, main dishes and desserts.  We have not found anything that we do not love.  Everything is fresh and so flavorful.  You can watch them pull the pita bread out of the oven before they serve it steaming hot to your table. YUM!  You can tell that they really take pride in the food and in the service.

2KCboh8LVR2qANKJvc9Y9w.text: From the minute I walked in the door I felt welcomed by the hostess and promptly greeted by my handsome waiter, Mahmoud.  He took the time to explain some of the Lebanese menu items to me and even let me sample the fried cauliflower that was yummy !  I ordered the chicken/beef kabobs with Basmati rice and mixed vegetables on the side. The service and food was exceptional and the warm atmosphere made it even better.  Thank you all for a lovely dinner

KXk_uFKLwLH_ZB_bvXxXlA.text: Had lunch had lunch here with my friends at this comfortable restaurant that features Lebanese and  Mediterranean bill of fare. Specialties such as chicken and lamb kebabs, shawarma, hummus, eggplant salad, lentil soup, stuffed grape leaves and a variety of other  salads, spreads, pita bread, etc. Prices reasonable, good portions, plated nicely,  and friendly service. A great restaurant serving tasty food, lots of vegetarian choices and healthy plant based foods. We ordered chicken kabob platter, shawarma salad and grilled shrimp over rice platter. Soft warm pita bread and olive oil on the table.

3UlNeg4L52Ib_kmzOdccqg.text: Game changing experience. Where has this been hiding???   So we went for lunch and a few big things...  They give you HOT pita with hummus, which is just delish. They keep bringing more pita too.  They have a garlic sauce that is to die for. I put it all over my salad.  Portions are very large but not expensive. My brother got the kebabs and couldnt finish them.  We didnt get dessert but it looked great.  WE WILL BE BACK. The staff were super nice and so proud of their food too. Its a happy place!

J4EHpp9Ex2Ay11DNRW3c9g.text: Service was great but the food was ohh status, maybe because we ordered wraps instead of plates. We didnt get any hummus , maybe it was our choice of entry. Would I go back...maybe not but it is something different if u do want to try something  new, just do the plates and stick to what I know

JNWCBArvtsKCkzd99HUqGw.text: I absolutely love this place. My only (selfish) gripe: why isn't there one closer to uptown?  Kabab-Je is a Mediterranean restaurant with a focus on the Lebanese cultural region. So, a lot of healthy ingredients- olive oil, garlic, lean meats, mixed veggies. Everything is made fresh in-house.  I tend to over-order here every time. The problem is that I just want too many things. I really love all the sides, so I will typically get a veggie plate. I usually go with stuffed grape leaves, the smoked eggplant dip (moutabal), falafel, and the potatoes. If I'm with someone, I like to do a veggie plate, plus hummus, and kababs of some sort so we can split it all.  Bottom line, I don't really think you can go wrong with anything you get here. There's a reason this place lands so high on the Yelp Charlotte Top 100 list every year. If you're unsure about the menu or have questions, make sure to ask. Everyone is so nice and friendly. I highly recommend coming with a group of friends, so you can order a bunch of things and share.   If the Matthews restaurant is not convenient for you, they also have a location over in Stonecrest.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. All the kebabs
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Poprock Photograohy in action
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Stuffed grape leaves

9xM7eSQ9eEXxbpY41I81lQ.text: Delicious! Tasty house made table bread, delicious hummus, shawarma was so-so, lovely grilled lamb sandwich and fabulous falafel. The service was very friendly.

2clUNglizMwv8I-2UvjZAA.text: Wonderful addition to Charlotte's rapidly expanding culinary scene.  I visited mid-week as part of Yelp's International Supper Club, and pronounce we have a winner here.   Lebanese food, as it was explained to us, is not hot-n-spicy but delicious, nonetheless, with flavors textures, and recipes common to the region.  I think they basically cooked the menu for us: potatoes, hummus, kebbeh, stuffed grape leaves, fattoush salad, falafel, musakaa, tabbouleh, babaganous, fried cauliflower, chicken, steak and lamb kabobs.  My favorite?  The kebbeh.  Ground lamb surrounded by goodness and fried to a crunchy exterior.  Mmm.  Service was spectacular.  Thank you,  Kate, for how you handled my end of the long table.  I'm a fan. I say, "Give 'em a whirl" and see for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Platter of happiness
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Yelp spot on WBTV
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Getting a big plug by Nikki on WBTV

4YmnXQXGhFk13PEvwilh3w.text: I've heard such good things about this place so I was really excited to come for Yelp's International Supper Club.  They prepared a set menu for us and it was quite a feast. We had pita, hummus, stuffed grape leaves, babaganoush, musakaa, fried cauliflower, falafel, kibbeh, spicy potatoes, a spinach pocket thing that I  forget the name of, tabboulehh, and a huge kabob platter with chicken, beef, and kafta.   Everything was quite good. I loved the style because we got to try so many things. Some of my favorites were the hummus, fried cauliflower, falafel, kibbeh, potatoes, fattoush, tabbouleh, and the kafta kabobs (ok that's almost everything, but it was all really good).  I definitely think this is some of the best Mediterranean food you'll find in Charlotte. I'd recommend going with a group and sharing so you can try a lot of things!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Potatoes
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Fattoush
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Spinach things

FzCwGBLi0sGkU7WQThYDxA.text: I always enjoy this restaurant and continue to return.  A four star review is simply because everything is really good but I wouldn't go as far as rating it stellar.  I always start off with the fried cauliflower and add a side of their garlic sauce.  The garlic sauce is very strong and don't plan on kissing anyone for 24-48 hours after having it.  This dish is my favorite and I would go back for this alone.  This trip I ordered a falafel wrap and side of veggies.  Both were really good and consistent with the other times I've ordered the same.

4Oawjt3LJwbG0lz48cR-JA.text: Looooove this place for authentic Lebanese food. Taste just like the homemade Lebanese food I grew up on. The prices are great but the food is 1000 times better. I wish they would open another location. Preferably in South Charlotte. So delicious! Highly recommend!

0RWj3Er4KbFwddZEzC_1Cw.text: Mediterranean greatness! This family restaurant is located in the plentiful shopping center of sycamore commons and it's a great place to walk and window shop. There's a nice outdoor patio you can also enjoy. It's a nice dining atmosphere, clean and simple. The servers are so friendly and helpful in describing the menu items if needed.   Most of the menu has helpful descriptions but what you need to know is everything is delicious and you just can't go wrong. We loved the fried cauliflower appetizer, a big portion, a whole cauliflower cut into chunks, not breaded, just slightly crispy on the outside, drizzled with a yogurt tahini mild sauce, delicious!  For lunch I chose the meat schwarma sandwich, a pita rolled with meat slices, pickles, and veggies with a sauce, then crisped and heated, so good! They also offered sandwiches and plates with falafel, chicken, kofta, tabouli, salads, and more. My sister with severe diet restrictions eats here often. We ended out meal with amazing baklava and tuxedo cake. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Fried cauliflower, big portion, delicious
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu info
Photo of Kabab-Je Rotisserie & Grille - Matthews, NC, United States. Sandwich comes wrapped up, fresh from the toaster

CjlwnNUwk57TQiJSUuEUkg.text: Let's start off with saying this is one of my favorite go-to spots. Kabab-Je has the most delicious food and the service is consistently good.  The menu is packed with plenty of freshly prepared options, but they always offer daily specials at a great value.  They bake their pita bread on site and that Tahini sauce they offer is out-of-this-world!  If you need two, it's totally worth it to pay for an extra sauce because you will probably be asking for a to-go box and will want more sauce with your left-overs!

Pqar7H2HRORg5YoPYARHKw.text: Went here with a foodie group last week and wowza. This place is out of where I would go to casual grab food as it is a trek for me, so I used this opportunity to try new things out of my comfort-zone. What a spread we got devour! I will note my favorites with an asterisk.  FOOD: - Hummus Dip. Made in-house and creamy fresh taste. - Smoked Eggplan. Made in-house with a Tahini paste. Wowza!  - Fried Cauliflower*. Fried with a tahini sauce. If I knew how to make this. I'd be in trouble, as I would have so much gas. SUPER delicious! - Kibbeh. Ground lamb crispy shell, filled with lamb onion mix. Filled. - Moussaka. Delicious stewed tomato with spices.  - Tabbouleh. Parsley salad with tomatoes. - Fattoush*. This is my favorite salad. Lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and crispy pita chips. I do not know what the reduction dressing is, but it's so delicious. - Spicy Potatoes*. Fried, cubed potatoes, tossed in spices. Again, if I knew how to make it I would be in trouble. It's so yummy, I would be as wide as I am tall and it would all be worth it. - Kafta**************. This is a mix of ground beef and lamb, grilled on a skewer. This is my favorite dish here.  - Chicken Kabab. Seasoned chicken cubes, grilled and still juicy in the center. - Beef Kabab. Seasoned beef cubes, grilled to medium-well perfection.  The skewers / kababs come with safron rice, grilled veggies on the side.  ATMOSPHERE: It's a family run restaurant. The staff is attentive and friendly. Ample parking as it is situated inside a strip mall area. Close to 485.  I will definitely come back and make the trek, it was so worth it.

UpqkhX7SqZSSLCr0KK72Vw.text: Laid back vibe with great service. Oh and the food is awesome too. The spicy lebanese salad with chicken was light and tasty. Wish they weren't so far away!
